data.title: Life as Film
data.meta_description: If you’re anything like me, you love movies. And even if you’re nothing like me, you probably still like movies.

But consuming movies at the rate that I do has gotten me thinking about a lot of things, like what keeps me coming back to these films I own? Maybe it’s Tarantino's sharp and witty dialogue, or Hou Hsiao-Hsien's intricate, layered compositions. Maybe it's the stories...

Well obviously, it’s a lot of factors. And a lot of factors I - nor you - have the time for today. Let's look at just one aspect of filmmaking that I find lacking today.

Now I count myself as particularly fond of Art Cinema aesthetics and narrative devices. And although they inhabit sometimes truly abstract or expressive spaces, according to Bordwell (2008), they almost always relate back to a very specific and indeed universal element of the human condition: ambiguity.
